Message.Issue: Correct the spelling of 'Crashlog' in member name 'InvariantStrings.CrashlogEmail' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of 'Dir' in member name 'InvariantStrings.EffectsSubDir' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of 'Dir' in member name 'InvariantStrings.FileTypesSubDir' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of 'Pdn' in type name 'PdnInfo'.
Correct the spelling of 'Dir' in member name 'PdnInfo.GetApplicationDir()' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.

Because the behavior of 'string.IndexOf(string)' could vary based on the current user's locale settings, replace this call in 'PdnInfo.GetIsFinalBuild()' with a call to 'string.IndexOf(string, StringComparison)'. If the result of 'string.IndexOf(string, StringComparison)' will be displayed to the user, such as when sorting a list of items for display in a list box, specify 'StringComparison.CurrentCulture' or 'StringComparison.CurrentCultureIgnoreCase' as the 'StringComparison' parameter. If comparing case-insensitive identifiers, such as file paths, environment variables, or registry keys and values, specify 'StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase'. Otherwise, if comparing case-sensitive identifiers, specify 'StringComparison.Ordinal'.
Correct the spelling of 'Ngen' in member name 'PdnInfo.GetNgenPath()' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of 'Ngen' in member name 'PdnInfo.GetNgenPath(bool)' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.

The compound word 'WebSite' in member name 'PdnInfo.LaunchWebSite(IWin32Window)' exists as a discrete term. If your usage is intended to be single word, case it as 'Website' or strip the first token entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.

The compound word 'WebSite' in member name 'PdnInfo.LaunchWebSite(IWin32Window, string)' exists as a discrete term. If your usage is intended to be single word, case it as 'Website' or strip the first token entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.

Because the behavior of 'string.IndexOf(string)' could vary based on the current user's locale settings, replace this call in 'PdnInfo.LaunchWebSite(IWin32Window, string)' with a call to 'string.IndexOf(string, StringComparison)'. If the result of 'string.IndexOf(string, StringComparison)' will be displayed to the user, such as when sorting a list of items for display in a list box, specify 'StringComparison.CurrentCulture' or 'StringComparison.CurrentCultureIgnoreCase' as the 'StringComparison' parameter. If comparing case-insensitive identifiers, such as file paths, environment variables, or registry keys and values, specify 'StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase'. Otherwise, if comparing case-sensitive identifiers, specify 'StringComparison.Ordinal'.
Correct the spelling of 'Pdn' in type name 'PdnResources'.
Correct the spelling of 'Png' in member name 'PdnResources.GetImageBmpOrPng(string)' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of 'Gdi' in member name 'PdnResources.IsGdiPlusImageAllowed(Stream)' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of 'Dir' in member name 'PdnResources.ResourcesDir' or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.

Rule.Name: Compound words should be cased correctly
Rule.Description: Avoid creating compound words from terms which exist in the dictionary as discrete terms. Do not create a compound word such as 'StopWatch' or 'PopUp'. These terms are recognized in the dictionary and should be cased as 'Stopwatch' and 'Popup'.
Rule.Resolution: The compound word '{0}' in member name {1} exists as a discrete term. If your usage is intended to be single word, case it as '{2}' or strip the first token entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.

Rule.Name: Identifiers should be spelled correctly
Rule.Description: The individual words that make up an identifier should not be abbreviated and should be spelled correctly. If this rule generates a false positive on a term that should be recognized, add the word to the FxCop custom dictionary.
Rule.Resolution: Correct the spelling of '{0}' in member name {1} or remove it entirely if it represents any sort of Hungarian notation.
Correct the spelling of '{0}' in type name {1}.

Rule.Name: Specify StringComparison
Rule.Description: If an overload exists that takes a StringComparison argument, it should always be called in favor of an overload that does not.
Rule.Resolution: Because the behavior of {0} could vary based on the current user's locale settings, replace this call in {1} with a call to {2}. If the result of {2} will be displayed to the user, such as when sorting a list of items for display in a list box, specify 'StringComparison.CurrentCulture' or 'StringComparison.CurrentCultureIgnoreCase' as the 'StringComparison' parameter. If comparing case-insensitive identifiers, such as file paths, environment variables, or registry keys and values, specify 'StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase'. Otherwise, if comparing case-sensitive identifiers, specify 'StringComparison.Ordinal'.
